holidays.name: National Yo-Yo Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the classic toy that has amused generations with its ups and downs—literally!
holidays.origin: June 6 is recognized as National Yo-Yo Day in honor of the toy's long history, with some crediting the iconic design and popularity surge to June days in the early 20th century.
holidays.funFact: The yo-yo is believed to be one of the oldest toys in history, dating back to 500 BCE in ancient Greece!

holidays.name: Drive-In Movie Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the nostalgia of cinema under the stars in your car at a classic drive-in theater.
holidays.origin: Drive-In Movie Day commemorates the first drive-in movie theater which opened on June 6, 1933, in Camden, New Jersey, changing entertainment forever.
holidays.funFact: At its peak in the 1950s, there were over 4,000 drive-in theaters in the United States — more than the number of Starbucks locations today!

holidays.name: National Gardening Exercise Day
holidays.description: A day to recognize gardening as a sneaky way to get your workout while playing in the dirt and growing green things.
holidays.origin: Inspired by the health benefits of gardening, this day encourages everyone to dig, plant, and prune their way to fitness.
holidays.funFact: An hour of gardening can burn as many calories as a brisk walk — bonus points if you’re chasing runaway garden tools!

holidays.name: World Pest Day
holidays.description: A day to raise awareness about the importance of pest control for food safety, health, and property protection worldwide.
holidays.origin: Established on June 6, 2017, this day highlights the role of pest management professionals and the impact pests have globally.
holidays.funFact: Without pest control, up to 40% of the world's food crops could be lost to pests — time to appreciate those pest-fighting heroes!
